And this is not mentioning the fact that DreamWorks Animation had been an independent entity since 2004 and switched distributions from themselves to Paramount to Fox.

Unlike the previous examples, Universal now owns all of DWA's library after they bought the entire company.
DreamWorks inked a new distribution deal with Disney, who released their movies from 2011 to 2016 and currently owns them after the deal ended.

The ownership of the live action DreamWorks is also confusing. Paramount bought them in late 2005 but later split them off in 2008 while they continued to distribute their new releases until 2011.

All their releases from their inception to that point are now owned by Paramount.
